qas.question: What is known to sometimes result in injury or death?
What is another name for Anhimidae?
What is another name for steamer ducks?
What do stone curlews use to punch and hammer opponents?

answers.text: bony knob on the alular metacarpal

context: A dearth of field observations limit our knowledge, but <a0_0>intraspecific conflicts<a0_0/> are known to sometimes result in injury or death. The <a1_0>screamers<a1_0/> (Anhimidae), some jacanas (Jacana, Hydrophasianus), the spur-winged goose (Plectropterus), the torrent duck (Merganetta) and nine species of lapwing (Vanellus) use a sharp spur on the wing as a weapon. The steamer ducks (<a2_0>Tachyeres<a2_0/>), geese and swans (Anserinae), the solitaire (Pezophaps), sheathbills (Chionis), some guans (Crax) and stone curlews (Burhinus) use a <a3_0>bony knob on the alular metacarpal<a3_0/> to punch and hammer opponents. The jacanas Actophilornis and Irediparra have an expanded, blade-like radius. The extinct Xenicibis was unique in having an elongate forelimb and massive hand which likely functioned in combat or defence as a jointed club or flail. Swans, for instance, may strike with the bony spurs and bite when defending eggs or young.
